title: SpaceX Falcon 9 Suffers In Flight Engine Failure, Starlink Payloads Lost
summary: SpaceX Falcon 9 Suffers In Flight Engine Failure, Starlink Payloads Lost

title: Falcon 9 suffers upper stage engine failure
summary: The engine on the upper stage of a SpaceX Falcon 9 malfunctioned during a launch July 11, causing the potential loss of a batch of Starlink satellites and creating repercussions across the space industry.

title: Lunar spacecraft receive dozens of collision warnings
summary: Even a few spacecraft in orbit around the moon can create dozens of warnings of potential collisions that require several maneuvers to avoid.

title: NASA Remembers Retired Astronaut, US Air Force Pilot Joe Engle
summary: Retired NASA astronaut and U.S. Air Force Maj. Gen. Joe Engle died July 10, surrounded by his family at home in Houston. Among his many honors, he is the only astronaut to pilot both the X-15 and space shuttle. He was 91. Engle became an astronaut at age 32 while flying the X-15 for the […]

title: Microsoft leads $40 million funding for Starlink networking startup
summary: Armada has raised an extra $40 million through a Microsoft-led funding round to develop mobile data centers tailored for SpaceX’s Starlink broadband network, the San Francisco-based startup announced July 11.

title: General Atomics to build second Space Force weather satellite
summary: General Atomics will provide three years of operational services for two Electro-Optical Weather System, or EWS, satellites.

title: Dawn Aerospace gets approvals for supersonic rocketplane tests
summary: Dawn Aerospace says it has received approvals from the New Zealand government for a new round of supersonic flight tests of a rocket-powered suborbital spaceplane.

title: 45 Years Ago: Skylab Reenters Earth’s Atmosphere
summary: A few days before they left Skylab on Feb. 8, 1974, the final crew to occupy the station raised its altitude, hoping to keep it in orbit until a future space shuttle could revisit it. But higher than predicted solar activity caused the Earth’s atmosphere to expand, increasing drag on the large vehicle, causing its […]

title: Electrical and Mechanical Technician Clifton Brown
summary: “We have a group photo of my first project here, ASTRO-H, and that one means a lot to me because I came [to that NASA project] fresh off the street. I was super scared and intimidated. It was me and three other [technicians], who were also all new, and a handful of very seasoned scientists […]

title: Starliner crew confident spacecraft will bring them safely home
summary: Helium leaks and thruster issues prompted NASA to extend their stay aboard the space station indefinitely -- Wednesday marked their 35th day in orbit -- while engineers carry out tests and analysis to better understand what caused the problems and to make sure the spacecraft can safely being Wilmore and Williams home.
